snippet: Freedom Industries, whose chemical spill last week in West Virginia tainted the drinking water of more than 300,000 residents in and around Charleston, is seeking Chapter 11 protection.
abstract: Freedom Industries, West Virginia company whose chemical spill tainted the drinking water of more than 300,000 residents in and around Charleston, files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy; lawyer for company says puncture in aging chemical storage tank allowed 7,500 gallons of chemical methanol to escape tank and leach into the Elk River, source of drinking water for Charleston and surrounding communities.
lead_paragraph: Freedom Industries, whose chemical spill last week in West Virginia tainted the drinking water of more than 300,000 residents in and around Charleston, is seeking Chapter 11 protection.

headline.main: Company in West Virginia Spill Files for Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Company in Chemical Spill Files Bankruptcy Papers
